▲教學目標：

The primary objective of this class is to familiarize students with the development of Irish literature after modernism. The students will have the opportunity to explore their individual interests while reading literary works by major Irish writers in the modern era. Specific emphasis will be on the cultural revival, genre development, social change, and contemporary issues.

▲教材內容：

1.  Orientation Meeting

Transitions: From the Victorian to the modern

1.  W. B. Yeats: Selected Poems
2.  J. M. Synge: _The Playboy of the Western World_
3.  James Joyce: “Eumaeus” (_Ulysses_)

1.  Group Discussion: The semester project
2.  Spring Break
3.  Individual conference 01

Developments after 1930

1.  Samuel Beckett: _Waiting for Godot_
2.  Flann O’Brien: _The Third Policeman_

1.  Individual conference 02

Debating social change after 1960

1.  William Trevor: Selected short stories

Contemporary issues

1.  Brian Friel: _Translations_
2.  Seamus Heaney: Selected Poems
3.  Emma Donoghue: _Room_

Final Presentations

1.  Presentation 01
2.  Presentation 02

Final Papers

1.  Consultation
2.  Consultation
